data.title: Everything You Need to Know About Kern High School District
data.meta_description: Discover all the essential information about Kern High School District on our website. Get insights into programs, facilities, and more.
data.text:
Overview

No matter which part of the country you live in, you want the best educational facilities for your children. If you are in the Kern High School District (KHSD), there is no need to worry – this area offers plenty of options.

This blog will explore detailed information about Kern High School District.

▸Website: www.kernhigh.org

▸Location: 5801 Sundale Ave., Bakersfield, CA 93309

▸Phone: 661- 827-3100

Kern High School District is one such district doing a great job. Let’s take a closer look at what they’re doing to help students learn better.

The Kern High School District, the largest high school district in California for grades 9-12, serves over 42,000 students. To meet the diverse needs of its students, the district offers 19 regular high schools, five schools for students who need extra help, the Regional Occupational Center (ROC), Bakersfield Adult School, two career training centers (CTEC), the Kern Aquatic Complex, and several special education sites.

Location

The Kern High School District is situated in Kern County, California, at the southern end of the San Joaquin Valley. The district office is in the city of Bakersfield.

Mission

The district ensures equal and fair access to jobs and education. KHSD bans discrimination, harassment, intimidation, or bullying in any job or education setting based on age, ancestry, color, gender, disability, race, religion, sexual orientation, and other protected characteristics under California and federal law.

Each school district has its unique and interesting history, and KHSD is no exception.

History

The KHSD has a long story of its past in Kern County. In the 1892 General Election, residents voted to start the county’s first high school. On January 12, 1893, Kern County High School opened, later renamed Bakersfield High School in 1945.

Classes started with 32 students in two rooms on the second floor of a building at Truxtun Avenue and L Street. The first graduation was two years later with three students. Today, over 200,000 students have graduated from KHSD.
